Fear of shark attacks is peculiar. I was visiting Florida in 1998 or so and on the Mexican Gulf side I and my english college decided to go swimming from the beach in Fort Meyers. When we were in the water people started to shout to us that we need to get out from there because of high probability of shark attack. When we finally came out we went to the beach cafe and asked around that when had a shark attacked human in Florida's gulf side and no-one could tell us. If you google it there have not been recorded incident 131 years but for some reason the locals are scared to swim there.

Derek I've got a question. Clouds are made from water which is in a gas state right? But at standard room temperature and pressure water exists as a liquid, and only becomes a gas on a large scale at 100.c.
